overview: This honours research project in the School of Agriculture, Food and Ecosystem Sciences Sciences aims to develop a student's ability to design and undertake a substantial body of work, to find solutions to a particular problem, and to report on this in written and verbal form. Project definition is completed shortly after commencement of the semester of enrolment in the subject, and requires approval from the subject coordinator.

Students will enrol in the 25 point iteration of this subject in one semester and the 50-point iteration in the second semester to ensure they have completed a total of 75 points for the research project by the end of their course
intended learning outcomes: Identify, describe and discuss the scientific process including the research methodologies necessary to design and interpret experiments In Food Science
Critically evaluate knowledge gained from a range of scientific sources
Devise controlled studies to enable the collection and interpretation of valid data
Disseminate the method and findings of a research project in Food Science in oral and written form
Effectively analyse, and scientifically evaluate problems and reach appropriate conclusions

assessments.description: Project proposal - outline of the project. 500-1000 words. Hurdle requirement:. satisfactory completion of project proposal
assessments.timing: Four to six weeks from commencement of Semester 1

assessments.description: Proposal seminar, presentation based on the proposal. 10 minutes. Hurdle requirement:. satisfactory completion of the proposal seminar
assessments.timing: Four to six weeks from commencement of Semester 1
Two weeks before the end of Semester 2

assessments.description: Thesis, One written thesis to be submitted for examination. 15000-20000 words
assessments.timing: During the last week of Semester 2

Semester 1 (Extended).Contact hours: This subject is an individual research project and weekly contact hours will vary depending on the nature of the project.

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
